member.name: M:Rage.InternetTime.GetCurrentDateTime
member.summary: Gets the current date and time from the internet.
member.remarks: The time server can only be accessed once every five seconds. If less than five seconds have passed since the last call to GetCurrentDateTime(), the time will be inferred from the last time returned. Note, that this limit is enforced across plugins.
member.returns: A representing the current time in UTC.

member.name: P:Rage.InternetTime.LastTime
member.summary: Gets the last time retrieved from the server.
member.value: The last time retrieved from the server.

member.name: P:Rage.InternetTime.TimeSinceLastAccess
member.summary: Gets the time elapsed since the time was last retrieved from the server.
member.value: The time elapsed since the time was last retrieved from the server.

member.name: P:Rage.InternetTime.CanAccess

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the time can be retrieved right now.
The time server can only be accessed once every five seconds. If less than five seconds have passed since the last call to GetCurrentDateTime(), this property will return false.

member.value: true if the time can be retrieved; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Class for getting the current time from the Internet.
This class uses the TIME protocol to get the current time from nist1-macon.macon.ga.us.

member.name: P:Rage.VehicleWheel.IsFacingLeft

member.name: P:Rage.VehicleWheel.IsSteeringWheel

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this wheel is used for turning the vehicle.

member.value: true if this wheel is used for turning the vehicle; otherwise false.
member.remarks: Which way the wheel turns is determined by the sign of AngleLimit.

member.name: P:Rage.VehicleWheel.Temperature

summary.para: Gets or sets a value representing the temperature of this wheel.

member.name: P:Rage.VehicleWheel.AngleLimit

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum number of degrees this wheel can turn when steering inwards.
This value also affects the maximum angle when turning outwards, however this value will be scaled to be a little larger.

member.value: The maximum number of degrees this wheel can turn when steering inwards.

member.summary: Performs a linear interpolation between two matricies.
member.param: Start matrix.
End matrix.
Value between 0 and 1 indicating the weight of .
When the method completes, contains the linear interpolation of the two matricies.
member.remarks: This method performs the linear interpolation based on the following formula. start + (end - start) * amount Passing a value of 0 will cause to be returned; a value of 1 will cause to be returned.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The to execute the tasks on.

members.member:
TODO: EXCEPTION IF PLUGIN HAS YIELDED FROM CREATION TILL EXECUTION! TaskSequence works by calling task natives after opening a sequence task, meaning any task executed after opening the sequence task will be part of the sequence. So, if one plugin opens a sequence, and then sleeps before executing, any task executed by other plugins will become part of the first plugin's sequence.
Atm, it only checks if time has passed from creation to execution.
This class allows executing multiple tasks on a in sequence.

summary.para: Gets a value indicating whether the animation represented by this task is currently playing.

member.remarks: Animations do not play on the tick they were started, so if calling this to check whether an animation has ended, make sure to yield for one tick after calling .PlayAnimation().

members.member: If HookWindowProc() succeeds, this function is called every time the game receives window messages.
If HookDeleteVehicleAndClearPedTasksImmediately() succeeds, this function is called every time DELETE_VEHICLE is called. Return true to permit the deletion; false to block the call.
If HookDeleteVehicleAndClearPedTasksImmediately() succeeds, this function is called every time CLEAR_PED_TASKS_IMMEDIATELY is called. Return true to permit the deletion; false to block the call.
* If HookGetLocalizedString() succeeds, this function is called every time the game * requests a localized string. If this function returns NULL, the original function is executed. *

member.summary: Create an IFW1FontWrapper object with default settings.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: The ID3D11Device the font-wrapper will be used with.

The default font-family to use when drawing strings. Valid values include for example L"Arial" and L"Courier New", provided that the fonts are installed on the system. Font-fallback will automatically choose a different font if the specified one is not available.
Address of a pointer to a font-wrapper (See IFW1FontWrapper).

member.name: T:IFW1Factory
member.summary: Used to create all subsequent FW1 objects. An IFW1Factory can be created using FW1CreateFactory.
member.remarks: Any and all FW1 objects are always created through a factory. All FW1 objects inherit from IFW1Object, and holds a reference to the factory that created them. If an object in turn creates new objects, it uses the same factory that created the object itself. For example, a glyph-atlas will ask the factory that created it to create new glyph-sheets as glyphs are added to the atlas.

member.name: M:IFW1FontWrapper.Flush(ID3D11DeviceContext*)
member.summary: Flush any new glyphs to GPU resources.
member.remarks: This method calls IFW1GlyphAtlas::Flush to flush any newly cached glyphs. This method is only needed if drawing text using the FW1_NOFLUSH flag and delaying flushing data to the device, as otherwise it is implicitly called whenever a string is drawn. See IFW1GlyphAtlas::Flush.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: The device context to use to update device resources.

member.name: M:IFW1FontWrapper.DrawGeometry(ID3D11DeviceContext*,IFW1TextGeometry*,FW1_RECTF!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.Single!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Draw geometry.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: The device context to draw on.
The geometry to draw.
A pointer to a rectangle to clip the text to if also using the FW1_CLIPRECT flag, or NULL to not clip. This rect is in text-space, and clipping is performed prior to any transformation.
An array of 16 floats, representing a matrix which the text will be transformed by, or NULL to draw in screen-space.
See the FW1_TEXT_FLAG enumeration.

member.name: M:IFW1FontWrapper.AnalyzeTextLayout(ID3D11DeviceContext*,IDWriteTextLayout*,System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,IFW1TextGeometry*)
member.summary: Analyze a text layout and generate geometry to draw it.
member.remarks: Consult the DirectWrite documentation for details on how to construct a text-layout. pTextGeometry can be NULL if the FW1_ANALYZEONLY or FW1_CACHEONLY flags are specified, as no actual geometry will be generated. pContext can be NULL if the FW1_NOFLUSH flag is used, as any new glyphs will not be flushed to the device buffers.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: A device context to use to update device buffers when new glyphs are added to the glyph-atlas.
The DirectWrite text layout to create geometry from.
The X origin of the text in the layout.
The Y origin of the text in the layout.
The default color of the text, as 0xAaBbGgRr.
See FW1_TEXT_FLAG. The alignment and word-wrapping flags have no meaning when using a preconstructed text layout.
An IFW1TextGeometry object that the output vertices will be appended to.

member.name: T:IFW1FontWrapper
member.summary: The IFW1FontWrapper interface is the main interface used to draw text. It holds references to all objects needed to format and convert text to vertices, as well as the D3D11 states and buffers needed to draw them.
member.remarks: Create a font-wrapper using IFW1Factory::CreateFontWrapper

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphVertexDrawer.DrawVertices(ID3D11DeviceContext*,IFW1GlyphAtlas*,FW1_VERTEXDATA!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Upload the specified vertices to the device buffers and draw them.
member.returns: Returns the index of the sheet in the atlas that was last bound to the device context during the operation.
member.param: The context to use to draw.
The glyph atlas containg the glyphs referenced by the vertices.
Pointer to an FW1_VERTEXDATA structure, containing vertices to be drawn, sorted by glyph sheet. These are easiest obtained from an IFW1TextGeometry object.

Can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_NOGEOMETRYSHADER - Vertices are converted to quads on the fly on the CPU, instead of being sent directly to the device for the geometry shader.
FW1_BUFFERSPREPARED - The internal buffers are assumed to already be set on the device context from a previous call. (Avoids redundant state changes when drawing multiple times).

If a sheet in the atlas is known to already be correctly set on the device context, specify its index in the atlas with this parameter, to avoid redundant state changes. If no sheet is known to already be set, specify 0xFFFFFFFF, or another value greater than the number of sheets in the atlas.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphVertexDrawer.GetDevice(ID3D11Device**)
member.summary: Get the ID3D11Device that the buffers are created on.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an ID3D11Device.

member.name: T:IFW1GlyphVertexDrawer
member.summary: A container for a dynamic vertex and index buffer, used to draw glyph vertices.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphRenderStates.HasGeometryShader
member.summary: Returns whether a geometry shader is available.
member.remarks: When an IFW1GlyphRenderStates object is created, it may attempt to create a geometry shader, depending on the parameters passed to IFW1Factory::CreateRenderStates. If a geometry shader is not created, either because of the specified parameters or because the device feature level does not support geometry shaders, this method will return FALSE.
member.returns: Returns TRUE if a geometry shader is available, and otherwise returns FALSE.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphRenderStates.UpdateShaderConstants(ID3D11DeviceContext*,FW1_RECTF!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.Single!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*)
member.summary: Update the internal constant buffer.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: The context to use to update the constant buffer.
A pointer to a rectangle to clip drawn glyphs to.
An array of 16 floats, representing a matrix which all glyph vertices will be multiplied with, in the geometry or vertex shader.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphRenderStates.SetStates(ID3D11DeviceContext*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the internal states on a context.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: The context to set the states on.

Can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_NOGEOMETRYSHADER - States are set up to draw indexed quads instead of constructing quads in the geometry shader.
FW1_CLIPRECT - Shaders will be set up to clip any drawn glyphs to the clip-rect set in IFW1GlyphRenderStates::UpdateShaderConstants.

member.name: T:IFW1GlyphRenderStates
member.summary: This interface contains all render states and shaders needed to draw glyphs.

member.name: M:IFW1TextRenderer.DrawTextLayout(IDWriteTextLayout*,System.Single,System.Single,System.UInt32,System.UInt32,IFW1TextGeometry*)
member.summary: Convert a text layout to vertices.
member.remarks: This method internally calls the IDWriteTextLayout::Draw method, and handles callbacks to convert the formatted text into vertices, which will be stored in the passed IFW1TextGeometry object. This method is not thread-safe.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: A DirectWrite text layout. See the DirectWrite documentation.
The X origin of the text.
The Y origin of the text.
The default text color, as 0xAaGgBbRr.

Can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_ALIASED - No anti-aliasing is used when drawing the glyphs.
FW1_NONEWGLYPHS - No new glyphs are inserted into the atlas. Not previously cached glyphs are replaced with a fallback glyph (usually an empty box).
FW1_CACHEONLY - All glyphs are queried from the glyph-provider and cached in the glyph-atlas, but no geometry is produced.
FW1_ANALYZEONLY - The text-layout is analyzed and glyph-maps are prepared, but the glyphs in the string are not cached and no geometry is produced.
An IFW1TextGeometry object that the output vertices will be appended to.

member.name: M:IFW1TextRenderer.GetGlyphProvider(IFW1GlyphProvider**)
member.summary: Get the IFW1GlyphProvider used by a text-renderer.
member.remarks: The glyph provider is used internally to get the atlas IDs for any glyphs needed when drawing a text layout.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an IFW1GlyphProvider.

member.name: T:IFW1TextRenderer
member.summary: A text-renderer converts DirectWrite text layouts into glyph-vertices.

member.name: M:IFW1TextGeometry.GetGlyphVerticesTemp
member.summary: Get the vertices in the geometry, sorted by glyph sheet.
member.remarks:
When glyphs are inserted into the geometry they contain their glyph atlas ID. The glyphs are internally sorted by glyph sheet, and glyphs returned by GetGlyphVerticesTemp contain the index of the glyph in its containing sheet, and not the atlas ID.
This method is not thread-safe.
member.returns: An FW1_VERTEXDATA structure containing the glyph vertices. The pointers in this structure are owned by the geometry object and should not be modified. They are valid until the next call to a method in the IFW1TextGeometry.

member.name: M:IFW1TextGeometry.AddGlyphVertex(FW1_GLYPHVERTEX!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*)
member.summary: Adds a vertex to the geometry.
member.remarks:
The GlyphIndex member of the FW1_GLYPHVERTEX specified when inserting a vertex should be the atlas ID of the desired glyph, as ((SheetIndex << 16) | GlyphIndex). See IFW1GlyphAtlas::InsertGlyph.
This method is not thread-safe.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: Pointer to an FW1_GLYPHVERTEX structure describing the vertex.

member.name: M:IFW1TextGeometry.Clear
member.summary: Clear any vertices currently contained in the geometry object.
member.remarks: This method is not thread-safe.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: T:IFW1TextGeometry
member.summary: A dynamic list of vertices. Note that this object is a simple array without synchronization and not safe to use simultaneously on more than one thread.
member.remarks:
When rendering a string, a vertex is inserted into an IFW1TextGeometry object for each glyph. The vertices in an IFW1TextGeometry can be drawn by the IFW1FontWrapper::DrawGeometry method.
A pointer to the actual vertices can be obtained with the IFW1TextGeometry::GetGlyphVerticesTemp method.

member.summary: Draw a glyph-image.
member.remarks:
The data returned in the FW1_GLYPHIMAGEDATA should only be read, and is valid until the next call to a method in the IFW1DWriteRenderTarget.
This method is not thread-safe.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: The DirectWrite font face containing the glyph.
The index of the glyph in the font face.
The size of the font.
The DirectWrite rendering mode. See DirectWrite documentation.
The DirectWrite measuring mode. See DirectWrite documentation..

member.name: T:IFW1DWriteRenderTarget
member.summary: Container for a DirectWrite render-target, used to draw glyph images that are to be inserted in a glyph atlas.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphProvider.GetAtlasIdFromGlyphIndex(System.Void!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.UInt16,IDWriteFontFace*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get the ID of the specified glyph in the glyph-atlas.
member.remarks: If FW1_NONEWGLYPHS is not specified, any glyph not currently in the atlas will be inserted before the method returns.
member.returns:
The ID of the specified glyph in the glyph-atlas. The ID is always ((SheetIndex << 16) | GlyphIndex), where SheetIndex is the index of the sheet texture the glyph is placed in, and GlyphIndex is the index of the glyph in that sheet.
If the specified glyph does not exist and can not be inserted on demand, the ID of a fallback glyph is returned.
member.param: A pointer identifying a glyph-map, previously obtained using IFW1GlyphProvider::GetGlyphMapFromFont. If this parameter is NULL, the ID of the last-resort fallback glyph is returned, which will be zero.
The index of the glyph in the DirectWrite font face. Glyph indices can be obtained from DirectWrite using IDWriteFontFace::GetGlyphIndices.
The DirectWrite font face that contains the glyph referenced by GlyphIndex.

Can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_NONEWGLYPHS - No new glyphs are inserted.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphProvider.GetGlyphMapFromFont(IDWriteFontFace*,System.Single,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Get a pointer identifying a glyph-map matching the specified font.
member.remarks: If the FW1_NONEWGLYPHS flag is not specified, new glyph-maps are created on demand. The glyph-map returned from this method is not meaningful outside of the glyph provider internals, but is needed for subsequent calls to IFW1GlyphProvider::GetAtlasIdFromGlyphIndex.
member.returns:
A constant pointer identifying a glyph-map. This pointer should only be used in subsequent calls to IFW1GlyphProvider::GetAtlasIdFromGlyphIndex, and remains valid for the lifetime of the IFW1GlyphProvider.
A NULL pointer may be returned, if using the FW1_NONEWGLYPHS flag and a matching glyph-map does not exist.
member.param: A DirectWrite font face.
The size of the font.

Can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_ALIASED - No anti-aliasing is used when drawing the glyphs.
FW1_NONEWGLYPHS - No new glyph-maps are created.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphProvider.GetDWriteFontCollection(IDWriteFontCollection**)
member.summary: Get the DirectWrite font-collection referenced by a glyph-provider.
member.remarks: The DirectWrite font collection is used internally only to match font-faces to unique names. Since different IDWriteFontFace objects can reference the same font, a reliable method of identifying a font is required. This is the only function of the font-collection in the scope of the glyph-provider. A font-face not from the same collection can still be used when requesting glyphs, in which case it will only be identified by its pointer value.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an IDWriteFontCollection.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphProvider.GetDWriteFactory(IDWriteFactory**)
member.summary: Get the DirectWrite factory a glyph-provider references.
member.remarks: The DirectWrite factory is used internally to create render-targets needed to draw glyph-images that are put in the glyph-atlas.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an IDWriteFactory.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphProvider.GetGlyphAtlas(IFW1GlyphAtlas**)
member.summary: Get the IFW1GlyphAtlas this glyph-provider references.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an IFW1GlyphAtlas.

member.name: T:IFW1GlyphProvider
member.summary: Collection of glyph-maps, mapping font/size/glyph information to an ID in a glyph atlas.
member.remarks: Whenever a glyph or glyphmap is queried from the glyph-provider, it will be dynamically inserted if it does not already exist.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphAtlas.InsertSheet(IFW1GlyphSheet*)
member.summary: Insert a sheet into the atlas.
member.remarks: This method is used internally whenever new glyphs no longer fits in existing sheets. The atlas will hold a reference to the sheet for the remainder of its lifetime.
member.returns:
On success, eturns the index of the sheet in the atlas after insertion.
If the method fails, 0xFFFFFFFF is returned.
member.param: A pointer ot the glyph sheet to insert.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphAtlas.InsertGlyph(FW1_GLYPHMETRICS!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.Void!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Insert a glyph into the atlas.
member.remarks: The parameters for this method can be obtained as part of the FW1_GLYPHIMAGEDATA structure filled in by the IFW1DWriteRenderTarget::DrawGlyphTemp method.
member.returns:
If the glyph is inserted, the ID of the new glyph in the atlas is returned. The ID is always ((SheetIndex << 16) | GlyphIndex), where SheetIndex is the index of the sheet texture the glyph is place in, and GlyphIndex is the index of the glyph in that sheet.
If the method fails to insert the glyph, the returned value is 0xFFFFFFFF.
member.param: A pointer to an FW1_GLYPHMETRICS structure, specifying the metrics of the glyph to be inserted.
A pointer to image data.
The number of bytes in a row of image data.
The number of bytes between successive pixels.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.Flush(ID3D11DeviceContext*)
member.summary: Flush any new glyphs to the internal D3D11 buffers.
member.remarks: When glyphs are inserted into the sheet only the CPU-memory resources are updated. In order for these to be available for use by the GPU, they must be flushed to the device using a device-context.
member.returns: No return value.
member.param: The context to use when updating device resources.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.CloseSheet
member.summary: Close the sheet for additional glyphs.
member.remarks: After calling this method any subsequent attempts to insert new glyphs into the sheet will fail. Calling this method can save some memory as the RAM copy of the texture can be released after the next call to IFW1GlyphSheet::Flush.
member.returns: No return value.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.InsertGlyph(FW1_GLYPHMETRICS!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.Void!System.Runtime.CompilerServices.IsConst*,System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Insert a glyph into the sheet.
member.remarks: The parameters for this method can be obtained as part of the FW1_GLYPHIMAGEDATA structure filled in by the IFW1DWriteRenderTarget::DrawGlyphTemp method.
member.returns:
If the glyph is inserted, the index of the new glyph in the sheet is returned. This index can be used to get the glyph's coordinates from the sheet coord buffer. See IFW1GlyphSheet::GetCoordBuffer and IFW1GlyphSheet::GetGlyphCoords.
If the method fails to insert the glyph, the returned value is 0xFFFFFFFF.
member.param: A pointer to an FW1_GLYPHMETRICS structure, specifying the metrics of the glyph to be inserted.
A pointer to image data.
The number of bytes in a row of image data.
The number of bytes between successive pixels.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.BindSheet(ID3D11DeviceContext*,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Set the sheet shader resources on the provided context.
member.remarks: This method sets the sheet texture as a pixelshader resource for slot 0, and optionally the coord buffer as geometryshader resource for slot 0.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: The context to set the sheet shader resources on.

This parameter can include zero or more of the following values, ORd together. Any additional values are ignored.
FW1_NOGEOMETRYSHADER: don't bind the coord buffer as a shader-resource for the geometry shader, even if it's available.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.GetGlyphCoords
member.summary: Get a sheet's coord-buffer, as an array of FW1_GLYPHCOORDS.
member.remarks: The returned buffer is valid for the lifetime of the sheet, and may only be read and never altered. The maximum valid index at any given time is one less than the number of glyphs in the sheet, which can be queried using IFW1GlyphSheet::GetDesc.
member.returns: Returns a constant pointer to the sheet's coord-buffer.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.GetCoordBuffer(ID3D11ShaderResourceView**)
member.summary: Get the ID3D11ShaderResourceView for the sheet's coord buffer.
member.remarks:
The coord buffer contains 32 bytes per glyph, stored as two float4, representing the data in an FW1_GLYPHCOORDS structure.
If the sheet is created without a hardware coord buffer, the method will return success and set the coord buffer to NULL. See IFW1Factory::CreateGlyphSheet.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an ID3D11ShaderResourceView.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.GetSheetTexture(ID3D11ShaderResourceView**)
member.summary: Get the ID3D11ShaderResourceView for the sheet's texture.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an ID3D11ShaderResourceView.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.GetDesc(FW1_GLYPHSHEETDESC*)
member.summary: Get the properties of a glyph sheet.
member.returns: Returns nothing.
member.param: Pointer to a sheet description.

member.name: M:IFW1GlyphSheet.GetDevice(ID3D11Device**)
member.summary: Get the ID3D11Device the sheet is created on.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an ID3D11Device.

member.name: T:IFW1GlyphSheet
member.summary: A sheet contains a texture with glyph images, and a coord-buffer with an FW1_GLYPHCOORDS entry for each glyph.

member.summary: Get the factory that created an object.
member.returns: Standard HRESULT error code.
member.param: Address of a pointer to an IFW1Factory.

member.name: T:IFW1Object
member.summary: All FW1 interfaces (except for IFW1Factory) inherits from IFW1Object.
member.remarks: Since all interfaces inhert from IFW1Object, the factory which created an object can always be queried with its GetFactory method.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.DefaultFontParams
member.summary: Description of the default font. See FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.VertexBufferSize
member.summary:
The size in bytes of the dynamic vertex buffer to upload glyph vertices to when drawing a string. 0 defaults to 4096 * 16.
Each glyph vertex is either 16 or 20 bytes in size, and each glyph requires either 1 or 4 vertices depending on if the geometry shader is used.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.DisableGeometryShader
member.summary: If set to TRUE, no geometry shader is used.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.MaxGlyphHeight
member.summary: The maximum height of a single glyph. This value is used to decide how large the DirectWrite render target needs to be, which is used when drawing glyph images to put in the atlas. 0 defaults to 384.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.MaxGlyphWidth
member.summary: The maximum width of a single glyph. This value is used to decide how large the DirectWrite render target needs to be, which is used when drawing glyph images to put in the atlas. 0 defaults to 384.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.AnisotropicFiltering
member.summary: If set to TRUE, the sampler-state is created with anisotropic filtering.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.SheetMipLevels
member.summary: The number of mip-levels for the glyph sheet textures. 0 defaults to 1.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.MaxGlyphCountPerSheet
member.summary: The maximum number of glyphs per texture. A buffer of MaxGlyphCountPerSheet * 32 bytes is preallocated for each sheet. 0 defaults to 2048.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.GlyphSheetHeight
member.summary: The height of the glyph sheet textures to store glyph images in. 0 defaults to 512.

member.name: F:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS.GlyphSheetWidth
member.summary: The width of the glyph sheet textures to store glyph images in. 0 defaults to 512.

member.name: T:FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS
member.summary: The FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS is used with the IFW1Factory::CreateFontWrapper method, and describes settings for the created IFW1FontWrapper object.
member.remarks: If a member has the value zero, the default value will be chosen instead. See FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS for requirements for its members.

member.name: F:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.pszLocale
member.summary: The locale. NULL for default.

member.name: F:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.FontStretch
member.summary: The font stretch. See DirectWrite documentation.

member.name: F:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.FontStyle
member.summary: The font style. See DirectWrite documentation.

member.name: F:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.FontWeight
member.summary: The font weight. See DirectWrite documentation.

member.name: F:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS.pszFontFamily
member.summary: The name of the font-family. Valid values include Arial, Courier New, etc. as long as the specified font is installed. Unavailable fonts will automatically fall back to a different font. This member can be set to NULL, if no default font is desired when using the structure to create a font-wrapper.

member.name: T:FW1_DWRITEFONTPARAMS
member.summary: Describes a single font. This structure is used in the FW1_FONTWRAPPERCREATEPARAMS structure.
member.remarks:
If pszFontFamily is NULL when creating an IFW1FontWrapper object, no default font will be set up. This is perfectly valid when drawing text using one of the DrawTextLayout methods. However, the DrawString methods will silently fail if no default font is set up.
If pszFontFamily is not NULL, the FontWeight, FontStyle and FontStretch members must be set to valid values according to the DirectWrite documentation. Zero is not a valid value for these.

member.name: T:FW1_GLYPHCOORDS
member.summary: Coordinates for a single glyph in the atlas.
member.remarks: Each glyph image inserted in a glyph sheet texture gets a unique index in that sheet, and a corresponding FW1_GLYPHCOORDS entry in the sheet's coord buffer, describing its location in the sheet as well as its dimensions.

member.name: T:FW1_TEXT_FLAG
member.summary: The current FW1 version.
member.remarks: This constant should be used when calling FW1CreateFactory to make sure the library version matches the headers.
member.summary: Describes overrides for how an FW1 operation is performed.
member.remarks: These flags can be used for any FW1 methods that take a flags parameter. Not all flags have any meaning for all methods however. Consult the documentation page for a particular method for information on what flags are valid.

member.name: F:FW1_UNUSED
member.summary: Don't use.

member.name: F:FW1_ANALYZEONLY
member.summary: A text-layout will be run through DirectWrite and new fonts will be prepared, but no actual drawing will take place, and no additional glyphs will be cached.

member.name: F:FW1_NONEWGLYPHS
member.summary: No new glyphs will be added to the atlas or glyph-maps. Any glyphs not already present in the atlas will be replaced with a default fall-back glyph (empty box).

member.name: F:FW1_CACHEONLY
member.summary: Any new glyphs will be cached in the atlas and glyph-maps, but no geometry is drawn.

member.name: F:FW1_NOFLUSH
member.summary: Any new glyphs added during a call are not flushed to the device-resources. It is a good idea to use this flag for text-operations on deferred contexts, when drawing text on multiple threads simultaneously, in order to guarantee the proper order of operations.

member.name: F:FW1_RESTORESTATE
member.summary: When a draw method returns, the device-context will have been restored to the same state as before the call.

member.name: F:FW1_IMMEDIATECALL
member.summary: Can be used as an optimization on subsequent calls, when drawing several strings with the same settings.

member.name: F:FW1_STATEPREPARED
member.summary: The correct shaders/constant-buffer etc. are assumed to already be bound. Can be used as an optimization when a previous call has already set the states, or to override the default states.

member.name: F:FW1_BUFFERSPREPARED
member.summary: The internal vertex and index buffer (if used) are assumed to already be bound. Can be used as an optimization when a previous call has already set the buffers.

member.name: F:FW1_CONSTANTSPREPARED
member.summary: The transform matrix and the clip-rect is not updated in the internal constant-buffer. Can be used as an optimization when a previous call has already set the correct data.

member.name: F:FW1_NOGEOMETRYSHADER
member.summary: No geometry shader is used when drawing glyphs. Indexed quads are constructed on the CPU instead of in the geometry shader.

member.name: F:FW1_CLIPRECT
member.summary: If a clip-rect is specified together with this flag, all text is clipped to inside the specified rectangle.

member.name: F:FW1_ALIASED
member.summary: Text is drawn without anti-aliasing.

member.name: F:FW1_NOWORDWRAP
member.summary: No automatic wrapping when the text overflows the layout-box.

member.name: F:FW1_BOTTOM
member.summary: Text is aligned at the bottom of the layout-box.

member.name: F:FW1_VCENTER
member.summary: Text is centered vertically.

member.name: F:FW1_TOP
member.summary: Text is aligned at the top of the layout-box. This is the default.

member.name: F:FW1_RIGHT
member.summary: Text is right-aligned.

member.name: F:FW1_CENTER
member.summary: Text is centered horizontally.

member.name: F:FW1_LEFT
member.summary: Text is left-aligned. This is the default.

member.summary: Adds a new console variable to this console.

members.member: Note: Since GameConsole::Update() is called from HookManager::Tick(), and Update() in return eventually calls the console commands, calling natives is fine; however, keep in mind that we're not in a plugin, and thus content will be cached in an instance of ContentCache in the hook, not a plugin.

member.name: M:Rage.MathHelper.ConvertMetersPerSecondToKilometersPerHourRounded(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the specified value from meters per second to kilometers per hour and rounds the result.
member.param: The value, in meters per second.

example.para: The following example converts 13.8889 m/s to km/h, rounded, and shows it in a notification.
example.code: int kilometersPerHourRounded = MathHelper.ConvertMetersPerSecondToKilometersPerHourRounded(13.8889f); Game.DisplayNotification("13.8889 m/s is ~" + kilometersPerHourRounded.ToString() + " km/h.");

member.returns: A representing the value in kilometers per hour.

member.name: M:Rage.MathHelper.ConvertMilesPerHourToKilometersPerHour(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts the specified value from miles per hour to kilometers per hour.
member.param: The value, in miles per hour.

example.para: The following example converts 31.0686 mph to km/h, and shows it in a notification.
example.code: float kilometersPerHour = MathHelper.ConvertMilesPerHourToKilometersPerHour(31.0686f); Game.DisplayNotification("31.0686 mph is " + kilometersPerHour.ToString() + " km/h.");

member.returns: A representing the value in miles per hour.

member.returns: A representing the value in miles per hour.

member.name: M:Rage.Vector2.DistanceSquared(Rage.Vector2,Rage.Vector2)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.returns: The distance between the two vectors.

member.name: M:Rage.World.GetGroundZ(Rage.Vector3,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the Z value of the ground surface at the specified position.
member.param: The position to get the ground at.
if set to true water will be treated as ground as well; otherwise, over water, the sea bottom will be treated as ground.
if set to true, the method may execute over many ticks (0 ticks, to several thousand milliseconds), but will be able to find most positions, even if several kilometers from the player.
member.returns: If successful, returns the Z value of the ground surface; otherwise, returns null.

remarks.para: Getting the ground Z value relies on world collision. World collision is normally only loaded around the player, so this method will work within a few hundred meters of the player.
If the specified position is at a location without world collision (eg. several kilometers from the player), the method will fail and return null, unless is set to true.
Furthermore, the method will also fail if the specified position is below the ground surface, unless is set to true.

If is set to true; this method may take several ticks (yielding the fiber) to execute, depending on the position and world collision. For example, if the specified position is far away from the player, the method will first have to load world collision at the position, wait for it to load, then find the Z value at the position.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.VerticalFlightPhase

summary.para: Gets or sets the vertical flight phase. This adjusts the thruster angle on VTOL enabled planes.
Note that the game will interppolate this property to the value of .
To have the plane remain at the specified value, set both properties to the same value.

member.value: A value between 0.0f and 1.0f, indicating the vertical flight phase.
member.remarks: This instance must represent a VTOL enabled plane.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.DesiredVerticalFlightPhase

summary.para: Gets or sets the desired vertical flight phase. This adjusts the thruster angle on VTOL enabled planes.
will be interpolated towards the desired value.

member.value: A value between 0.0f and 1.0f, indicating the desired vertical flight phase.
member.remarks: This instance must represent a VTOL enabled plane.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.FuelLevel

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of fuel in this vehicle.

remarks.para: When the amount of fuel is below 6.5f, the vehicle will start misbehaving.
When the amount of fuel reaches 0.0f, the engine will die.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.FuelTankHealth

summary.para: Gets or sets the health of the car's fuel tank.
The fuel tank health ranges between 0.0f and 1000.0f.
When the fuel tank health is below 700.0f, fuel will start leaking.
When the fuel tank health is below 50.0f, the engine will be unable to start.

member.value: The health of the car's fuel tank.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.EngineHealth

summary.para: Gets or sets the health of the car's engine.
The engine health ranges between 0.0f and 1000.0f.
When the engine health is below 400.0f, the engine will start to smoke.
When the engine health is 300.0f or below, the car's back fire will become smokey and sound worse.
When the engine health is below 300.0f, the car will have difficulties maintaining a stable acceleration.
When the engine health reaches 0.0f, the car's engine will die.

member.value: The health of the car's engine.

members.member:
While C++/CLI and the .NET framework supports indexers for all properties, C# only allow indexers for the 'this' property, so I made this work-around to allow indexers on these properties.
Gets the doors of this vehicle. The doors of this vehicle.

member.name: P:Rage.Vehicle.LicensePlate
member.summary: Gets or sets the license plate of this vehicle.
member.value: The license plate of this vehicle. Can be between 0 and 8 characters in length, inclusive.

members.member:
GTA V has both a setter and getter of this method. The getter in GTA V has 2 parameters. The first is the vehicle, the second seems to be a bool. I'm guessing the bool is whether to include or ignore the SET_VEHICLE_UNDRIVEABLE value, and only return whether the vehicle is driveable due to damage.
Gets or sets whether this instance is driveable. Whether this instance is driveable.

member.name: M:Rage.Ped.PlayAmbientSpeech(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,Rage.SpeechModifier)

summary.para: Plays the specified ambient speech.

member.param: The name of the voice to use. If null the 's current voice will be used.
The name of the ambient speech to play.
The number of the ambient speech to play. If equal to, or less than 0, a random number will be chosen.
A value indicating how to play the speech.
member.example: Assuming the 's current voice is "A_F_M_TRAMPBEAC_01_WHITE_FULL_01", plays a random of the following speeches. GENERIC_THANKS_01 GENERIC_THANKS_02 GENERIC_THANKS_03 PlayAmbientSpeech(null, "GENERIC_THANKS", 0, SpeechModifier.Force);
Assuming the 's current voice is "A_F_M_TRAMPBEAC_01_WHITE_FULL_01", plays GENERIC_THANKS_02. PlayAmbientSpeech(null, "GENERIC_THANKS", 2, SpeechModifier.Force);

summary.para: Gets or sets the relationship group of this instance.
Relationship groups indicate the acquaintance between different types of Peds.
For instance, by default CIVMALE and CIVFEMALE are set to respect each other; however, this behaviour can be changed.

CIVMALE could be set to hate CIVFEMALE, and CIVFEMALE could be set to hate CIVMALE, and all civilians would start fighting each other on side, males vs females. (Granted that they're in those respective groups, as males could certainly be added to the CIVFEMALE group.

Groups can also have different acquaintances between each other. For instance, imagine three new groups: DEVELOPER, CUSTOMER and PIRATE, where Peds in the DEVELOPER relationship group hate Peds in the PIRATE group and like (not respect) Peds in the CUSTOMER group. Peds in the PIRATE group like the Peds in the DEVELOPER group, and are neutral towards people in the CUSTOMER group. Peds in the CUSTOMER group like Peds in the DEVELOPER group and dislike Peds in the PIRATE group.
Any Ped in the DEVELOPER group will attack Peds in the PIRATE group on sight, but Peds in the PIRATE group won't attack Peds in the DEVELOPER group because they like them.
Gets a value indicating whether this instance is getting into a vehicle.

member.name: T:Rage.TaskStatus
member.summary: Indicates the status of a task.

member.name: F:Rage.TaskStatus.InProgress
member.summary: The task is currently being performed by the .

member.name: F:Rage.TaskStatus.Interrupted
member.summary: The task was temporarily interrupted, eg. if the is walking, and the player walks into the so it stumbles.

member.name: F:Rage.TaskStatus.None
member.summary: The task has not been performed yet, or has been done.

member.name: F:Rage.TaskStatus.Preparing
member.summary: Means the is waiting for events preventing it from performing its task, to end. Eg. if the task is issued while the is ragdolled.

member.name: F:Rage.TaskStatus.Unknown
member.summary: The current status of the task is unknown. Note, this value is never returned by the game.

member.name: T:Rage.VehicleDrivingFlags
member.summary: Flags for driving tasks.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Emergency
member.summary: This is a combination flag for emergency driving, disregarding most rules.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Normal
member.summary: This is a combination flag for normal driving, respecting rules.

summary.para: If this flag is specified, the vehicle will stop at the target.
Note, when this flag is specified, the task will never end.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will avoid highways when possible.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will ignore path finding and drive straight to the target.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will navigate using real-time path finding.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will cross medians, and make u-turns on highways with missing pieces of railing.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Reverse
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the vehicle will drive in reverse.

summary.para: If this flag is specified, the vehicle will use one-way streets in the wrong direction, and drive against traffic on high ways.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will respect the rules of an intersection.
The vehicle will slow down severely at stop signs, stop at red lights, and use the lanes designated for the direction it needs to go.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will drive around objects.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will drive around people.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will drive around other vehicles.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will yield for pedestrians crossing a crosswalk.
It will not yield to people who are not using a crosswalk.
If this flag is specified, the vehicle will drive as part of the traffic.
It will keep in line and use signallers. It will ignore intersection rules (Stop signs, traffic lights, lane designations, etc.).

member.name: T:Rage.LeaveVehicleFlags
member.summary: Flags for the LeaveVehicle task.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.BailOut
member.summary: Indicates that the should bail out of the vehicle if it's moving. Without this flag, the will still get out immediately, but without falling.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.LeaveDoorOpen
member.summary: Indicates that the should leave the door open after getting out.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.WarpOut
member.summary: Indicates that the should warp out of the vehicle.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.None
member.summary: Indicates no flags.
Indicates no flags.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.RagdollOnCollision
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the character will ragdoll if it collides with anything.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.DisableRootMotion
member.summary: If this flag is specified, root motion will be disabeld. Root motion lets animations drive the physics.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.NoSound3
member.summary: If this flag is specified, sound events attached to this animation will be removed. Eg. foot steps. The difference between this, NoSound1 and NoSound2 is currently unknown.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.NoSound2
member.summary: If this flag is specified, sound events attached to this animation will be removed. Eg. foot steps. The difference between this, NoSound1 and NoSound3 is currently unknown.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.NoSound1
member.summary: If this flag is specified, sound events attached to this animation will be removed. Eg. foot steps. The difference between this, NoSound2 and NoSound3 is currently unknown.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Idle
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the animation is only played if the character is standing still, and will be interrupted if it moves.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.SecondaryTask
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the animation will be played as a secondary task, allowing the character to perform other tasks, while still playing the animation.
member.example: This example will make the named ped, move around with his hands on his back, as if cuffed, by playing the cuffed idle animation as a secondary task. ped.Tasks.PlayAnimation("mp_arresting", "idle", 8f, AnimationFlags.UpperBodyOnly | AnimationFlags.SecondaryTask | AnimationFlags.Loop);ped.Tasks.PlayAnimation("mp_arresting", "idle", 8F, AnimationFlags.UpperBodyOnly Or AnimationFlags.SecondaryTask Or AnimationFlags.[Loop])ped->Tasks->PlayAnimation("mp_arresting", "idle", 8f, AnimationFlags.UpperBodyOnly | AnimationFlags.SecondaryTask | AnimationFlags.Loop); The UpperBodyOnly flag will play the animation only on the upper body. The Loop flag will make sure the animation plays over and over, forever. The SecondaryTask flag will make the animation play as a secondary task, so the character isn't blocked from moving or doing other tasks, like getting into or drive vehicles.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.UpperBodyOnly
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the animation will only play on the upper body.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.StayInEndFrame
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the animation will freeze on the last frame.

member.name: F:<unknown type>.Loop
member.summary: If this flag is specified, the animation will loop.

member.name: T:Rage.VehicleManeuver
member.summary: Represents the possible driving maneuvers for .

summary.para: Brings a submarine to the water surface.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 0%. Handbrake will be engaged.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 100%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to -100% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Will make the vehicle engage the handbrake, and steer the wheels towards the current movement direction, keeping the car as steady as possible.
The vehicle will attempt to make a u-turn by turning the wheels.
The vehicle will not attempt to gain enough speed first, and will fail to get all the way around if it isn't going fast enough when this maneuver is invoked.
The vehicle will attempt to make a u-turn by turning the wheels and pulling the handbrake.
The vehicle will not attempt to gain enough speed first, and will fail to get all the way around if it isn't going fast enough when this maneuver is invoked.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 100%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will not be touched, and can be set manually.
Sets acceleration to -50% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 30%.
Steering angle will be forced to -14.3239.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 30%.
Steering angle will be forced to 14.3239.
Simulates a car reacting to an oncoming car, by handbraking left or right.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 100%. Handbrake will be engaged.
Sets acceleration to -75% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to -40.
Sets acceleration to -75% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 40.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 0.1%.
Steering angle will be forced to -14.3239.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 0.1%.
Steering angle will be forced to 14.3239.
Sets acceleration to 50% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to -40.
Sets acceleration to 100% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 40.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 0%. Handbrake will be engaged.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 0%. Handbrake will be engaged.
Steering angle will be forced to -40.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 0%. Handbrake will be engaged.
Steering angle will be forced to 40.
Sets acceleration to -75% and braking power to 0%.
Steering angle will be forced to 0.
Sets acceleration to 0% and braking power to 20%.
Steering angle will not be touched, and can be set manually.

member.name: P:Rage.Entity.IsWaitingForWorldCollision

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this entity is waiting for world collision.
Entities waiting for world collision will not move or be affected by physics.

For example, if a vehicle is spawned far away from the player's current position, it'll remain stuck in the air, and will refuse to move, even if a Ped tries to drive it. Setting this property to false, will unfreeze the vehicle and allow it to move.

member.value: true if this entity is waiting for world collision; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this entity can take damage from collisions.
member.value: true if this entity can take damage from collisions; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: Collision involves any kind of impact to the entity, whether getting hit by vehicles or falling from high altitudes.
Melee attacks, however, are not considered collisions.

remarks.para: Different types of entities are considered dead under different circumstances.

item.description: s are considered dead when their drops below their fatal injury threshold value (See ).
s are considered dead when they're specifically marked as such (Eg. after going into water).
Any other type is considered dead when their health drops below 0.001f.

Getting or setting metadata is done using the same syntax as getting or setting a property.
Internally the value is added to a dictionary with the specified property name as key.

member.name: M:Rage.Vector3.DistanceSquared(Rage.Vector3,Rage.ISpatial)
member.summary: Calculates the distance between a vector and a , ignoring the Z-component.
member.param: The first vector.
The .
member.returns: The squared distance between the vector and the .
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:Rage.Vector4.DistanceSquared(Rage.Vector4,Rage.Vector4)
member.summary: Calculates the squared distance between two vectors.
member.param: The first vector.
The second vector.
member.returns: The squared distance between the two vectors.
member.remarks: Distance squared is the value before taking the square root. Distance squared can often be used in place of distance if relative comparisons are being made. For example, consider three points A, B, and C. To determine whether B or C is further from A, compare the distance between A and B to the distance between A and C. Calculating the two distances involves two square roots, which are computationally expensive. However, using distance squared provides the same information and avoids calculating two square roots.

member.name: M:Rage.PoolHandle.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The value.

summary.para: Represents the handle of an item in a pool.

The RAGE engine has a special array type known as a pool.
Pools are widely used throughout RAGE games to store things like s, s, s, s, etc.
Pools consist of slots, and each slot has an index ranging from 0 to the pools capacity.
Essentially each slot has a flag that indicates whether the slot is free, and a counter. The counter is purely to avoid duplicate handles in case that same slot is reused immediately after it's freed.
The handle is a composite number (32-bit unsigned integer) where the 24 most significant bits represent the item's index into the pool, and the last 8 bits represent the counter.
Eg. if an item is stored at index 4 and its counter is 7, the handle would be (4 << 8) | 7 = 1031 (0x00000407).
A handle is validated by comparing its counter to the counter in the slot indicated by the index in the handle. If the slot is occupied and the counters match, the handle is valid. These handles are used extensively in the engine's internal scripting system. If a native function takes an entity as parameter, it is by its handle.

member.name: M:Rage.Game.DisplayNotification(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new notification above the map.
member.param: The name of the game defined texture dictionary to display.
The name of the texture in the dictionary to display.
The title of the notification. Any HTML tags will be stripped.
The subtitle of the notification. Any HTML tags will be stripped.

param.name: text
param.para: Supports a small subset of HTML.

Note, that while the limit for this parameter is ~960 characters, notifications displayed using this overload has a small visual limit. The smaller the font size, the more text can be displayed. Use the overload for long texts.

member.returns: An unsigned 32-bit integer, representing the handle to the notification.

member.name: M:Rage.Game.DisplayNotification(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a new notification above the map.

param.name: text
param.para: Supports a small subset of HTML.

Note, that while the limit for this parameter is ~960 characters, the notification can only visually contain around ~800 characters of default sized text. The limit of ~960 characters can still be reached for texts that are shorter than 800 characters, eg. lots of HTML encoding.

member.returns: An unsigned 32-bit integer, representing the handle to the notification.

member.name: M:Rage.Game.FindPattern(System.String,System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Finds the specified pattern of bytes in the game's memory.
member.param: The pattern to find. Wildcard ?? is supported.
The address to start searching at. If , search is started at the base address.
member.returns: An representing the memory location the pattern was found at, or if the pattern wasn't found.

remarks.para: The pattern should be in the following format:
XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX
Where each XX is a hexadecimal value representing the byte, or ?? to indicate a wildcard.
All white space is ignored.
Even though the search algorithm is fast, you shouldn't be calling this every frame.
Ideally, you want to find all the patterns you need when your plugin initializes.

member.name: M:Rage.Game.FindPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Finds the specified pattern of bytes in the game's memory.
member.param: The pattern to find. Wildcard ?? is supported.
member.returns: An representing the memory location the pattern was found at, or if the pattern wasn't found.

remarks.para: The pattern should be in the following format:
XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX XX
Where each XX is a hexadecimal value representing the byte, or ?? to indicate a wildcard.
All white space is ignored.
Scan starts at the base address. Use overload to specify start address.
Even though the search algorithm is fast, you shouldn't be calling this every frame.
Ideally, you want to find all the patterns you need when your plugin initializes.

member.name: P:Rage.Game.IsPaused
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether the game is paused.
The game cannot be paused in certain cases, eg. when the console is open..
member.value: true if the game is paused; otherwise, false.

summary.para: Called on each frame.
Natives cannot be called in here, and any attempt to may crash the game.
Called on each tick to gather render calls.

This is not called on each frame, but rather each game tick, and draw calls get queued for the frame renderer.
This allows natives to be called from here; however, you may see flickering in the rendering because of this.
To avoid this, you can use which gets called on each frame, but won't allow native calls.
